column4: I have dell studio 15 with a 9 cell battery . it gives around 10 hours back up on windows vista but on ubuntu it only gives around 4 hours .. whats wrong?
run powertop and find out ... first thing is to get rid of mono immediatly
sudo apt-get autoremove libmono0 (will take some applications fike fspot  and tomboy away, too)
you don't know about your system load :-) because you don't know how often the cpu or some chip wake up
it doesn't work that way. powertop is reporting and suggesting things ... one after the other. you have to look and read what powertop is telling you.
and i can tell you upfront that mono is a cpu hog and waking up the cpu far too often... get rid of it. next make sure your cpu frq-scaling is working properly
the most obvious problem... the ati-drivers are junk... sad, but a fact of life
exactly... that's why they are junk

I know bad hardware support can ruin the whole day.... but i'm relatively sure that there'S a solution out on the web... dig a bit. I'm no ati expert, b/c i like to stay out of troubles way and always check linux support before i buy hardware
the real reason is: all operating systems suck, linux (and ubuntu in particular) just sucks less. And because it takes a while to recognize that,  we kill some time in here :-)
you found your man... phreck you probably should talk to phreck
